implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to retrieve all tasks. Enables users to view the list of tasks, which is foundational for managing them.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a GET request is made to /tasks:
    Call database.get_tasks()
    Return the list of tasks

implementation.name: get_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Fetches all tasks from the persistent storage. Used by endpoints to display or manipulate tasks.
implementation.pseudo_code:
If the tasks file does not exist:
    Return an empty list
Open the tasks file
Try to load JSON data
    For each item, create a Task object
    Return the list of Task objects
If JSON is invalid:
    Return an empty list

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives task data and delegates creation to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with a TaskCreate payload:
    Call database.add_task(task)
    Return the created Task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for adding a new task, assigning a unique ID, and saving it to storage.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get the current list of tasks
Create a new Task with a unique id and data from TaskCreate
Append the new Task to the list
Save the updated list
Return the new Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated data and delegates update logic to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a PUT request is made to /tasks/{task_id} with a TaskCreate payload:
    Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
    If no task is found:
        Raise 404 error
    Return the updated Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing task by ID with new data and saves the changes.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get the current list of tasks
For each task in the list:
    If task.id matches task_id:
        Create updated Task with new data
        Replace the old task
        Save the updated list
        Return the updated Task
If not found:
    Return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task by ID. Delegates deletion to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a DELETE request is made to /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If deletion fails:
        Raise 404 error
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes a task from storage by its ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get the current list of tasks
Remove the task with the matching id
If a task was removed:
    Save the updated list
    Return True
Else:
    Return False

implementation.name: Task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Data model representing a task, including fields for title, description, priority, due date, and completion status.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define a Task with:
    id: string
    title: string
    description: optional string
    priority: enum (Low, Medium, High)
    category: optional enum
    due_date: optional date
    completed: boolean

missing_implementations: A new task must include a description (currently optional in the model).
A new task must include a priority (currently defaults to Medium, not enforced as required input).
A new task must include a due date (currently optional in the model).
Marking tasks as Pending (completed: false) is only possible by editing the task, not via a dedicated endpoint or explicit action.
